parameters: "Hail, Commander! The Steward is inside awaiting you."
"Hail Commander! If you are looking for weapons, you are in the right place."
"Greetings Sire. Are you looking for to practice your skills? My men and I are ready for the challenge, should you choose to humble us. Or perhaps a refresher on the finer points of combat?"
"What would you like to learn more about?"
"Protection is the barrier that enemies must break through before you start taking real damage."
"In combat, the blue bar beneath your Health shows you your current amount of Protection."
"Most healing abilities do not recover Protection, but some do on occasion."
"The ability to inflict and remove status effects is the primary crux to all combat."
"Every person has a unique set of skills, some of which can inflict effects upon enemies and some of which can remove harmful effects from allies."
"For a comprehensive list of effects, please refer to the Status Effect Primer."
"There are six primary attributes: Max Health, Max Protection, Attack, Defense, Agility, and Luck."
"Max Health and Max Protection determine your total Health and Protection respectively."
"Attack determines how much damage you inflict upon an enemy, and Defense helps you reduce incoming damage from enemies."
"Agility determines the order in which everyone moves during combat. Higher Agility means moving first, which can be critical to success!"
"Lastly, Luck helps determine the chance of inflicting a debuff on an enemy or resisting a debuff from an enemy. Luck also contributes somewhat to the damage dealt during Critical Hits."
"There are two special Attributes, called Special Attack and Special Defense."
"Special Attack gives an increase of damage to your skill damage or healing, while Special Defense reduces incoming damage from special skills."
"Every single ally and enemy you encounter will have a unique set of skills and abilities."
"As Commander, it is your duty to create the best teams possible to fight against the enemies. Knowing how each ally's skills compliment each other is vital."
"Quite the beating you gave the men. They shan't forget the lesson anytime soon!"
"Were you holding back on us? I assure you, we can take it!"
"Quite the beating you gave the men. They shan't forget the lesson anytime soon!"
"Were you holding back on us? I assure you, we can take it!"
(Hmm, it appears boarded up from the inside. The Steward must have ordered it when he left.)
"We should be able to get everything we need in town before we head out."
GabText The soft din of townsfolk about their business rings in the air.
(Hmm, it appears boarded up from the inside. The Steward must have ordered it when he left.)
GabText The usual bustle of the town has been replaced with an eerie silence.
"If you are looking for Steward Eustice, he is long gone, with the company of the Sovereign."
"The Steward tasked me with killing you, should Lord Bullmont have failed his task."
"I suppose the Steward being a traitor might change your decision to heed those orders?"
"I am Lord Ellex's man, not Eustice's. I will help you seek justice for our Lord."
"It will be good to have your help. Where are the rest of the townfolk?"
"Most fled to Storm Pointe. Those who did not go willingly were put to the sword."
"Then there isn't anything left here for us. We should be going."
Kyle Swords has joined your Retinue.
"Well, if it ain't the Storm Commander himself!"
"I doubt you have much opportunity to travel West to the Drylands, but perhaps you might be interested in participating in the Dryland's Duels?"
"Only one of the greatest tests of a fighter's true strength!"
"You engage in a duel to the near death with an ever-increasingly difficult set of opponents to win highly valuable Platinum."
"There is a total of 9 duels, each one tougher than the previous, and each granting more Platinum."
"'Oh, but handsome stranger, what do I need Platinum for' you might be asking!"
"Why, we Dryland's Traders come across some of the most interesting things you could hope to find!"

"If you are looking to greatly increase your abilities, we have Manuals from all across the lands. If you are in need of additional sword hands, well... those can be had as well. Just talk to Smit here, he'll get you what you want!"
"So, it is that simple! Engage in some friendly blood letting, and earn some Platinum! What say ye?"
"When you are ready to begin, just come back and talk to me!"
"So, you have your weapons sharpened and armor polished? Then we shall begin!"

"I'll make sure this one goes easy for ya!"
